name: FORSEN AB
tagline: Hospitality PM Specialist with CM Expertise
description: Sweden's leading independent project and construction management company with proven hospitality track record (10+ hotel projects) and circular material procurement experience via Construction Management delivery method.
location: Stockholm HQ + nationwide (15+ offices from Luleå to Malmö)
keyProjects: Clarion Hotel Amaranten (461 rooms, live renovation)

quantifiedOutcomes.flagship: Clarion Hotel Amaranten (461 rooms, live renovation)
circularElements: 150 reused chairs from YLLW Factory (€180k savings vs. new)
CM procurement enabled 4-week flexibility for sourcing reused items
quantifiedOutcomes.lessonsLearned: Live hotel renovation requires phased approach (10 floors/month). CM delivery method gave contractor flexibility to integrate YLLW Factory lead times without penalty delays.

partnershipFramework.fyraIntegration: Complementary (Forsen PM + Fyra Design = no overlap)

riskAllocation.forsen: Project delivery timeline, budget overruns, contractor performance
riskAllocation.fyra: Design performance, FF&E quality, supplier documentation completeness
riskAllocation.shared: Circular material performance (mitigated via warranty requirements)

partnershipFramework.communicationProtocol: Weekly PM meetings, bi-weekly circular procurement review, monthly client reporting
partnershipFramework.escalationPath: Forsen PM → Forsen Project Director → Client Steering Committee

phase1.name: Initial Assessment & Alignment
activities: Forsen reviews Fyra design intent and circular targets
Joint feasibility workshop (Forsen PM + Fyra + Client)
Circular procurement strategy defined (CM delivery method agreed)
Preliminary budget and schedule with circular buffer (4-6 weeks)
phase1.cost: Included in pre-construction services (typically 2-3% of construction budget)

phase2.name: Supplier Integration & Procurement Planning
activities: Forsen engages contractors (3-4 bidders for CM approach)
Fyra + Forsen conduct supplier assessment (YLLW, Input, Rekomo)
Material passport requirements integrated into tender documents
Fire safety and regulatory strategy finalized with building inspector

phase3.name: Construction Execution
activities: Forsen leads construction coordination
Weekly circular procurement status reviews
Fyra coordinates with suppliers on delivery schedules
Joint quality inspections for reused items (Forsen + Fyra)
Documentation compilation for building authority final approval

proprietaryTools: Forsen Live Renovation Methodology (phased execution for operating hotels)
CM Procurement Framework (enables circular supplier flexibility)
Forsen Project Portal (real-time budget/schedule tracking for clients)

keyContactEnhanced.title: Project Manager - Hospitality Division
keyContactEnhanced.expertise: Live hotel renovations, CM delivery, Nordic Choice Hotels relationship
keyContactEnhanced.approach: Call first to introduce Fyra partnership concept, then request meeting with Erik + Hospitality Division Director

contact.reference: Mention: Grow Hotel CM circular success

strengths: CM leadership enables circular procurement flexibility
Pure PM (no design overlap with Fyra)

name: SWECO
tagline: Largest A&E with Proven Circular ROI
description: Largest A&E consultancy in Europe (22,000 employees) with quantified circular economy success. Blique by Nobis: €8.6M materials reused, 3,600 tons CO₂ saved, LEED Gold + Nordic Swan.
keyProjects: Blique by Nobis (249 rooms, €8.6M materials, 3,600 tons CO₂ saved)

quantifiedOutcomes.flagship: Blique by Nobis Stockholm (249 rooms, adaptive reuse of 1930s industrial warehouse)

metrics.certifications: LEED Gold + Nordic Swan Ecolabel + EU Green Building

circularElements: Entire 1930s warehouse structure retained (€45M demolition/rebuild avoided)
Original timber beams exposed as design feature (450+ beams)
Reclaimed bricks from facade demolition reused in interior walls (12,000 bricks)
Furniture: 60% reused/refurbished via YLLW Factory and auction sourcing
Original concrete floor polished (€120k vs. €450k new flooring)
Mechanical room repurposed from original boiler room

financialBreakdown.additionalCertificationValue: €2.8M property valuation premium (LEED Gold + Nordic Swan)

quantifiedOutcomes.lessonsLearned: Early engagement critical - Sweco involvement from pre-acquisition feasibility enabled structural assessment before purchase. C3 tool quantified embodied carbon savings, persuading conservative bank financing. Full design team integration (architecture + engineering + sustainability) accelerated certification process (9 months vs. 18 months typical for LEED Gold).

partnershipFramework.fyraIntegration: SCOPE CAREFULLY - Sweco can provide architecture, Fyra should focus on interior design/FF&E to avoid overlap

riskAllocation.sweco: Structural feasibility, MEP performance, certification achievement, project timeline
riskAllocation.fyra: Interior design performance, FF&E quality, guest experience delivery
riskAllocation.shared: Circular material integration success, cost targets

partnershipFramework.communicationProtocol: Bi-weekly integrated design meetings, monthly certification progress reviews, C3 tool shared access for carbon tracking
partnershipFramework.escalationPath: Sweco Project Lead → Sweco Buildings Division Director → Client Steering Committee
partnershipFramework.criticalScoping: MUST DEFINE at contract: If Sweco provides architecture, Fyra scope = interior design + FF&E only. OR Fyra provides architecture, Sweco scope = engineering + PM only.

phase1.name: Feasibility & Certification Strategy
activities: Sweco structural assessment of existing building
C3 tool baseline carbon analysis (existing vs. demolish/rebuild)
Certification pathway selection (LEED/BREEAM/Nordic Swan)
Fyra + Sweco joint design workshop (scope alignment critical)
Preliminary circular opportunity assessment (what can be reused?)
phase1.cost: Feasibility study €25-40k (often funded by property owner pre-acquisition)

phase2.name: Integrated Design Development
activities: Sweco: Architecture + MEP engineering (if contracted) or Engineering only (if Fyra does architecture)
Fyra: Interior design, FF&E concept, circular supplier engagement
Bi-weekly integrated design sessions (all disciplines)
C3 tool ongoing carbon tracking (design decisions informed by carbon impact)
Building permit application preparation (Sweco leads)
phase2.cost: Design phase: ~5% of construction value (split Sweco engineering + Fyra design)

phase3.name: Construction & Certification
activities: Sweco: PM coordination, engineering oversight, certification management
Fyra: FF&E procurement, circular supplier coordination, installation oversight
Monthly carbon tracking updates (C3 tool)
Quarterly certification progress reviews with LEED/BREEAM assessor
Final documentation compilation for certifications
phase3.cost: PM services: 6,000-8,000 SEK/day, Certification management: €40-80k additional

proprietaryTools: C3 Tool (Carbon Calculation for Construction) - quantifies embodied carbon for design decisions
Sweco Climate Compass - climate adaptation assessment for buildings
Circular Economy Assessment Framework - structured evaluation of reuse opportunities
LEED/BREEAM Fast-Track Process - integrated design methodology for certification

keyContactEnhanced.title: Senior Consultant - Circular Economy & Sustainability
keyContactEnhanced.expertise: Circular economy strategy, LEED/BREEAM certification, adaptive reuse, C3 tool methodology
keyContactEnhanced.approach: Email Amanda directly with Blique reference, request 1-hour discovery meeting to discuss Fyra partnership model. Clarify scope boundaries (architecture vs. engineering) in first meeting.

contact.reference: Mention: Blique success (3,600 tons CO₂ saved)

concerns: Design overlap - Sweco DOES architecture (scope carefully!)
Large firm complexity - need specific team
scopingCritical: MUST clarify: Sweco PM+Engineering | Fyra Interior Design to avoid overlap

name: HIFAB AB
tagline: 70 Years PM Experience, Pure PM Focus
description: Established project management and owner's advisory firm with 70+ years experience, 400 employees, 15 offices nationwide. Pure PM (does NOT do design) = natural Fyra partner. Known for cost-effective, reliable execution.
location: Stockholm HQ + 15 offices (most comprehensive regional coverage)

quantifiedOutcomes.flagship: Clarion Hotel @ Arlanda Airport City (200 rooms, adaptive reuse of 1980s office building)

metrics.certifications: BREEAM In-Use Good (not Very Good - limited sustainability specialist)

circularElements: Existing office building structure retained (€18M demolition/rebuild avoided)
HIFAB coordinated with Rekomo for building materials (doors, fixtures)
Furniture: 20% reused (budget project, Fyra would enable higher % with circular focus)

financialBreakdown.pmFeeSavings: HIFAB 15% lower fees than Sweco/Forsen (€180k saved on PM)

quantifiedOutcomes.lessonsLearned: HIFAB excels at cost-effective execution and regulatory navigation (12-month permit process vs. 18-month Stockholm average). However, lacks in-house sustainability expertise - project achieved BREEAM Good (not Very Good) due to missed certification opportunities. Ideal partner when Fyra leads sustainability strategy.

partnershipFramework.engagementModel: Pure PM + Owner's Advisory (No Design Services)
partnershipFramework.fyraIntegration: COMPLEMENTARY - HIFAB PM + Fyra Design + Fyra Sustainability Lead = Zero Overlap

riskAllocation.hifab: Project delivery (schedule + budget), contractor performance, regulatory approval
riskAllocation.fyra: Design performance, sustainability targets, circular procurement, FF&E quality
riskAllocation.shared: Client satisfaction, cost overruns from circular material delays (mitigated via contingency)

partnershipFramework.communicationProtocol: Weekly PM status meetings, bi-weekly circular procurement reviews, monthly client reports (HIFAB leads)
partnershipFramework.escalationPath: HIFAB PM → HIFAB Regional Director → Client Owner's Representative
partnershipFramework.idealStructure: HIFAB as PM backbone, Fyra as design + sustainability leader. HIFAB ensures reliable execution, Fyra drives innovation.

phase1.name: Project Setup & Procurement Strategy
activities: HIFAB establishes project controls (budget, schedule, risk register)
Fyra presents circular procurement strategy and sustainability targets
Joint workshop: HIFAB + Fyra + Client to align on priorities
HIFAB prepares contractor tender documents incorporating Fyra's circular requirements
Building permit pre-application meeting (HIFAB coordinates, Fyra attends)

phase2.name: Design Coordination & Permitting
activities: HIFAB coordinates design team (Fyra design + engineering consultants)
Weekly design review meetings (HIFAB ensures schedule adherence)
Fyra develops circular procurement plan with supplier lead times
HIFAB submits building permit application (incorporating Fyra's circular documentation)
Value engineering sessions (HIFAB identifies savings opportunities, Fyra ensures circular targets maintained)
phase2.cost: Design phase PM: ~6,000 SEK/day (most cost-effective vs. Sweco/Forsen)

phase3.name: Construction Management
activities: HIFAB: Daily contractor coordination, schedule tracking, budget control
Fyra: FF&E procurement, circular supplier coordination, quality inspections
Weekly construction meetings (HIFAB leads, Fyra attends for circular items)
Monthly client reporting (HIFAB compiles, Fyra provides circular impact updates)
Final commissioning and handover (HIFAB coordinates)
phase3.cost: Construction PM: ~6,000 SEK/day (15-20% lower than Sweco/Forsen)

proprietaryTools: HIFAB Project Portal (real-time budget/schedule dashboard for clients)
70-Year BBR Regulatory Database (institutional knowledge of Swedish building code evolution)
Partnering Contract Templates (collaborative delivery method for reduced disputes)
Public Sector Procurement Framework (compliant with Swedish LOV law)

keyContactEnhanced.title: Head of Project Management - Stockholm Region
keyContactEnhanced.expertise: Hotel project management, adaptive reuse, public sector procurement, BBR regulatory navigation
keyContactEnhanced.approach: Initial call to Christian Horn. Emphasize Fyra's sustainability leadership (HIFAB appreciates expertise partners). Request pilot project proposal meeting. HIFAB values long-term partnerships over one-off projects.

bestFor: 50-100 room projects where Fyra leads sustainability

contact.askFor: Christian Horn or experienced hospitality PM

strengths: Pure PM (zero design overlap with Fyra)

name: WSP SVERIGE
description: Global engineering consultancy (70,000 globally, 4,000+ Sweden) with strong sustainability tools. Best as technical partner (engineering + sustainability) rather than lead PM.

contact.keyPeople: Erik Höglund (Sustainability Director), Maria Brogren (Green Building)

concerns: Best as sub-consultant, not lead PM
recommendedUse: Pair with Forsen (lead PM) + WSP (engineering) + Fyra (design) for complex projects

name: AFRY AB
description: Architecture + engineering + sustainability with Swedish-Finnish heritage. Office-to-hotel conversion experience (Fyrkanten, BREEAM Very Good) and Nordic Choice energy program.

name: RAMBOLL SWEDEN
description: Major Nordic engineering firm with advanced circular economy credentials and published guidance, but limited hospitality PM track record (1-2 projects, sub-consultant roles).
verdict: Strong on circularity but insufficient hospitality track record for Fyra's primary PM needs. Possible use as sustainability specialist sub-consultant.
